task.title: Share Audio in Microsoft Teams Meeting
task.shortdesc: While sharing content during a Teams meeting, you can also share audio playing from your computer. When sharing audio, all sound from your computer, including notifications, will be audible to the meeting participants.

taskbody.prereq: You will need a Microsoft Teams account to access the meeting. You should already be sharing your screen to share audio.

step.cmd: Allow Microsoft Teams access to your computer audio.

info.note: On desktop, you must first allow Micrsoft Teams to access your computer audio before sharing sounds during a meeting.

step.cmd: Select the Share button, a rectangle with an upwards facing arrow.
Install the latest Teams audio driver in order to include computer audio in a Teams meeting and avoid sound issues like echoing.

info.note: On Mac, sound issues will occassionally occur when sharing audio.

taskbody.postreq: Use only one device's mic and speaker per room while in a Teams meeting to avoid echoing sound. Minimizing the number of apps active while in a meeting prevents audio-visual issues such as buffering or poor sound quality.
